title: Installing package (ack) modifies files in _source-cache
body:
On the latest commit (9a6a19d464f31d301fb333c5110042f9ead5d501), installing `ack` modifies its install file in the `_source-cache`.

## Steps to reproduce:

In a clean git repository:
```console
$ spack fetch -D ack
[...]

$ head -n 1 var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/fd/fd0617585b88517a3d41d3d206c1dc38058c57b90dfd88c278049a41aeb5be38
#!/usr/bin/env perl

$ spack install ack
[...]

$ head -n 1 var/spack/cache/_source-cache/archive/fd/fd0617585b88517a3d41d3d206c1dc38058c57b90dfd88c278049a41aeb5be38
#!/path/to/local/repo/of/spack/opt/spack/linux-archrolling-skylake/gcc-9.2.0/perl-5.30.0-glhysleiayklpn7q76zpgc3grihti4j6/bin/perl
```

I do not know if there are other packages where this is an issue. We use a static download cache for fresh spack installations and `ack` was the first package to suddenly fail  to install (after moving from [this commit](https://github.com/electronicvisions/spack/tree/sandbox/breitwieser/upstream_merge_base_7) to [that](https://github.com/electronicvisions/spack/tree/sandbox/breitwieser/upstream_merge_base_8)). I verified that the issue persists in `develop` until [now](https://github.com/spack/spack/commit/9a6a19d464f31d301fb333c5110042f9ead5d501).

I suspect that is related to the reorganization of the download cache in 4af448724f4f933b5306c4cdd2f7522d64dc8719.
